00013 #ifndef CIRCLE2_H
00014 #define CIRCLE2_H
00015 
00016 #include <geometry/Geometry.hpp>
00017 #include <geometry/Vec2.hpp>
00018 
00019 #include <assert.h>
00020 
00021 namespace geo
00022 {
00032     template<typename Type>
00033     class Circle2
00034     {
00035     public:
00037         Circle2(){}
00038 
00040         Circle2(const Vec2<Type> & a_center, Type a_radius)
00041         {
00042             setValue(a_center, a_radius);
00043         }
00044 
00046         Circle2(const Circle2<Type> & a_circle)
00047         {
00048             setValue(a_circle.m_center, a_circle.m_radius);
00049         }
00050 
00052         Circle2(const Vec2<Type> & p1, const Vec2<Type> & p2)
00053         {
00054             m_center = (p1 + p2) * 0.5f;
00055             m_radius = (p2 - p1).length();
00056         }
00057 
00059         Circle2(const Vec2<Type> & p1, const Vec2<Type> & p2, const Vec2<Type> & p3)
00060         {
00061             assert(setValue(p1,p2,p3)&&"Circle2::Circle2(p1, p2, p3): points are colinear!");
00062         }
00063 
00065         virtual ~Circle2(){}
00066 
00068         void setValue(const Vec2<Type> & a_center, Type a_radius)
00069         {
00070             m_center = a_center;
00071             m_radius = a_radius;
00072         }
00073 
00075         bool setValue(const Vec2<Type> & p1, const Vec2<Type> & p2, const Vec2<Type> & p3)
00076         {
00077             Type A2 = p1.sqrLength();
00078             Type B2 = p2.sqrLength();
00079             Type C2 = p3.sqrLength();
00080 
00081             // equation is (x - centre.x)^2 + (y - centre.y)^2 = radius^2
00082             Type det = 4* (p1.x()*p2.y() + p3.x()*p1.y() + p2.x()*p3.y() - p3.x()*p2.y() - p1.x()*p3.y() - p2.x()*p1.y());
00083 
00084             if(det != 0.0){
00085                 m_center[0] = 2 * (A2*p2.y() + C2*p1.y() + B2*p3.y() - C2*p2.y() - A2*p3.y() - B2*p1.y() )/det;
00086                 m_center[1] = 2 * (p1.x()*B2 + p3.x()*A2 + p2.x()*C2 - p3.x()*B2 - p1.x()*C2 - p2.x()*A2 )/det;
00087 
00088                 m_radius = (p1 - m_center).length();
00089                 return true;
00090             }
00091             m_center[0] = 0.0f;
00092             m_center[1] = 0.0f;
00093             m_radius = -1.0f;
00094             return false;
00095         }
00096 
00098         void setCenter(const Vec2<Type> & a_center)
00099         {
00100             m_center = a_center;
00101         }
00102 
00104         void setRadius(Type a_radius)
00105         {
00106             m_radius = a_radius;
00107         }
00108 
00110         const Vec2<Type> & getCenter() const
00111         { 
00112             return m_center; 
00113         }
00114 
00116         Type getRadius() const
00117         { 
00118             return m_radius; 
00119         }
00120 
00121         Type getSurface() const
00122         {
00123             return (Type)(M_PI * m_radius * m_radius);
00124         }
00125 
00126         Type getCircumference() const{
00127             return (Type)( 2.0 * M_PI * m_radius);
00128         }
00129 
00131         bool intersect(const Vec2<Type> & a_point) const
00132         {
00133             return ((a_point - m_center).sqrLength() <= m_radius*m_radius);
00134         }
00135 
00137         bool intersect(const Circle2<Type> & c, Vec2<Type> & p1, Vec2<Type> & p2) const
00138         {
00139             // Based on code from Paul Bourke
00140             // http://astronomy.swin.edu.au/~pbourke
00141 
00142             // dxy are the vertical and horizontal distances between the circle centers.
00143             Vec2<Type> dxy = c.m_center - m_center;
00144 
00145             // Determine the straight-line distance between the centers.
00146             Type d = dxy.length();
00147 
00148             // no solution. circles do not intersect.
00149             if (d > (m_radius + c.m_radius)) return false;
00150 
00151             // no solution. one circle is contained in the other
00152             if (d < std::abs(m_radius - c.m_radius)) return false;
00153 
00154             // 'point 2' is the point where the line through the circle
00155             // intersection points crosses the line between the circle
00156             // centers.  
00157 
00158             // Determine the distance from point 0 to point 2.
00159             Type a = ((m_radius*m_radius) - (c.m_radius*c.m_radius) + (d*d)) / (Type)(2.0 * d);
00160 
00161             // Determine the coordinates of point 2.
00162             Vec2<Type> xy2 = m_center + dxy * (a/d);
00163 
00164             // Determine the distance from point 2 to either of the intersection points.
00165             Type h = std::sqrt((m_radius*m_radius) - (a*a));
00166 
00167             // Now determine the offsets of the intersection points from point 2.
00168             Vec2<Type> rxy(-dxy[1] * (h/d), dxy[0] * (h/d));
00169 
00170             // Determine the absolute intersection points.
00171             p1 = xy2 + rxy;
00172             p2 = xy2 - rxy;
00173 
00174             return true;
00175         }
00176 
00177         friend std::ostream & operator<<(std::ostream & os, const Circle2<Type> & c)
00178         { 
00179             return os << c.m_center.x() << " " << c.m_center.y() << " " << c.m_radius; 
00180         }
00181 
00182     private:
00183         Vec2<Type>  m_center;   
00184         Type        m_radius;   
00185     };
00186 
00187     typedef Circle2<int>    Circle2i; 
00188     typedef Circle2<float>  Circle2f; 
00189     typedef Circle2<double> Circle2d;
00190 } // namespace geo
00191 
00192 #endif
